intro: Aconitopsis teheranica, commonly known as the Persian aconitopsis, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are usually blue or purple in color. Aconitopsis teheranica is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates.
